title: Expectations: shattered!
body:
Things I expected, but now find to be untrue:

  1. That the women's restroom would be cleaner than the men's. Surprisingly, this has yet to prove true.

  2. That Monday nights would see more than 15 people show up... total. My hypothesis is that only 10% of our potential market (if that) even know we're open yet. We get lots of people coming in "just to look around." The first thing they say is, "I didn't know you were open!" We've only just scratched the surface of our market saturation. We passed out a total of 100 flyers on Missouri State's campus the night before we opened. Then we dropped a few off at the Mud House, but that's about it. I think as the weeks draw on, we're going to see a steady increase in traffic. The biggest turning points will be a) when we get our permanent marquee up (as opposed to the same old banner that's been hanging out front for the last nine months), and b) when we do a full distribution of our monthly calendars.

    I remember reading an article about the Mud House and how for the first few months their business was nearly non-existent. The owners, Rob and Brian, took a look around and asked themselves, "did we do the right thing?" Then, slowly, word started to spread and people started to drop by more often. Now they're busy from open to close. Patience is the key here. Patience and good advertising.

  3. Budweiser isn't a big seller. That was a surprise. Believe it or not, Boulevard Wheat is our biggest money maker... along with Fitz's Orange Soda.

So there it is. A list of expectations that really surprised me. I'm sure things will turn around in October. We've got a good line-up of films (three of which are already visible here), and things can only get better from there.
author: Dan

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: I worked / lived in a dorm with 400+ females. We had to periodically lock the bathroom doors as punishment because they would keep them so disgustingly dirty.

comments.author: Matt
comments.body:
It's a shame i'm too far across the pond to have made it to the blog nights, and everyone thinks my shirt is an obscure Simpsons reference they just dont get.. but one comment I would immediately have is that, while awaiting word of mouth, fill the towns letter boxes with a nicely simple postcard that fits with the moxie brand, a nice spot gloss finish on the logo would be an elegant touch. Simply stating that the cinema is now open and everyones invited, maybe an offer for free 'snack size' (read: mini) popcorn that wont break your budget but nothing too cheesey IMO.

Just to set yourself with a good 'now open' awareness foundation for the word of mouth to build on?

comments.author: Sara

comments.author: Sara

comments.author: nicole

comments.author: Melinda
comments.body:
Yey!!! I don't have to clean the bathroom with a Q-tip!!! Yey!!!! I really enjoyed the Friday matinee of You and Me and Poop. Very comfy theater... I kinda like it not all packed, but I don't have a financial stake, so I could definitely handle a full crowd if it helps ya'll out.

Hope to make Murderball tomorrow evening. It will be a very interesting contrast to the family reunion I'm taking my mama to in Ava, MO earlier in the day.

xoxo,
nathaniel

Well, dingdong dang it! I have been so excited and eager for your opening, and very intrigued by the first film, but have I gotten there yet? Nope. I will, though. Hopefully tomorrow's matinee.
